name: Stellar Serenity
description:
It is a game that does not require us to be 100% concentrated paying attention to it, so it is ideal to play relaxed while talking with friends through a call, while listening to a podcast or simply while listening to the music we like.


in Stellar Serenity you are a robot traveling in a spaceship, full of junk to process and obtain materials with which to create items in case eventually one day (far, far away) humanity needs them to establish a new colony.
Perform a simple task, at your own pace. All in a low-poly retro-futuristic look with laid-back music.


Equip the items you create to unlock new and interesting facets of the game.


With them, you can improve or add new features to your robot, making it harder, better, faster, and stronger.


Or simply enabling cosmetic enhancements.


Install upgrades on your ship that allow you to automate certain tasks, ensuring your progress is constant.


Or use them for a while before putting them back in their boxes (believe me, nobody will notice).


In Stellar Serenity, there isn't just one way to do things: You can prioritize the fast and efficient processing of materials with specific upgrades, or you can simply immerse yourself in the environment that only the vastness of space can offer and process the materials at your own pace.
